accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The Archives of American art does not own the original papers. Use is limited to the microfilm copy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This microfilm collection consists of photographs of sculptures created by African American artist Sargent Johnson for the Federal Art Project.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reel NDA 18 available for use at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Originals returned to Lewis Ferbrache after microfilming.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Sargent Johnson (1888-1967) was an African American sculptor in northern California. He was one of the first African American artists working in California to gain national recognition, and exhibited in many Harmon Foundation exhibitions. In the late 1930s, Johnson worked for the Works Progress Administration Federal Arts Project.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The lender, Lewis Ferbrache, was an administrator of the Oakland Museum of Art and collected materials relating to federally funded art projects for AAA during its New Deal and the Arts project.
